abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sustainable Management
            of Fish Resources Project for Senegal were as follows:
            outcomes were unsatisfactory, global environment objectives
            (GEO) outcomes was unsatisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was high, risk to GEO outcome was high, Bank
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            include: project expanded and scaled up the fisheries
            resources co-management model which was piloted successfully
            with fishing communities under another Bank operation
            ongoing at the time Projet de Gestion Integree des
            Ressources Marines et Cotieres (GIRMaC Project). It also
            took into account synergies with other programs of the Bank
            (GIRMaC, West Africa Regional Project for Fisheries (WAFRP)
            and in country Canary Current Large Marine Ecosystem Project
            (CCLME) and collaborated closely in the preparation and
            design phase with other donors to ensure synergies in the
            sector. The Project was designed to be part of a larger
            program of donor interventions in the fisheries sector in
            order to respond to the Government's 2008 Letter of
            Sector Policy, and to be consistent with the
            Government's sector strategy.
